official_description: Non-custodial Ethereum and ERC20 privacy solution based on zkSNARKs
description: Fully decentralized, non-custodial cryptocurrency mixer protocol that runs on Ethereum Virtual Machine-compatible networks, enabling private transactions using zero-knowledge proof technology. Tornado Cash was sanctioned by OFAC in August 2022 but had sanctions lifted in March 2025 following a Fifth Circuit court ruling.

founders.name: Roman Storm
charges: conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business
founders.legal_status: pleaded not guilty, released on $2M bond

founders.name: Alexey Pertsev
founders.legal_status: sentenced to 5 years 4 months in prison

charges: conspiracy to operate an unlicensed money transmitting business

key_features: Immutable smart contracts (cannot be modified or shut down)
Fixed denomination pools for multiple tokens

ofac_sanctions.reason: Laundering over $7 billion in virtual currency since 2019, including $455M stolen by North Korean Lazarus Group

fifth_circuit_ruling.ruling: OFAC exceeded statutory authority; immutable smart contracts cannot be classified as 'property' under IEEPA
fifth_circuit_ruling.key_finding: Immutable contracts lack hallmarks of ownership, control, and exclusivity

sanctions_lifted.reason: Following Fifth Circuit ruling; OFAC exercised discretion acknowledging 'novel legal and policy issues'

legal_history.note: While OFAC sanctions were lifted in March 2025, criminal proceedings against founders Roman Storm and Alexey Pertsev continue

milestones.description: Tornado Cash v1 launched on Ethereum as experimental software
1,114 contributions to zk-SNARK trusted setup using multi-party computation (MPC), making protocol 'completely trustless and unstoppable'
Deployed to multiple side-chains and L2s beyond Ethereum
Total Value Locked reached peak of $1.17 billion
U.S. Treasury Department sanctioned Tornado Cash for laundering $7B including Lazarus Group funds
Dutch authorities arrested co-founder Alexey Pertsev in Amsterdam

milestones.event: Roman Storm Arrested, Roman Semenov Indicted
milestones.description: DOJ arrested Roman Storm in Washington State and indicted Roman Semenov (at large); OFAC sanctioned Semenov
Dutch court convicted Pertsev, sentenced to 5 years 4 months in prison
Fifth Circuit Court ruled OFAC exceeded authority; immutable smart contracts are not 'property' under IEEPA
OFAC officially delisted Tornado Cash following Fifth Circuit ruling
